distracted_boyfriend.name: Distracted Boyfriend
distracted_boyfriend.origin: Stock photo from 2015, went viral in 2017
distracted_boyfriend.meaning: Represents getting distracted by something new while ignoring your current commitment
distracted_boyfriend.usage: Used to show temptation, disloyalty, or changing preferences
distracted_boyfriend.example: Me (boyfriend) ignoring my responsibilities (girlfriend) to scroll TikTok (other woman)

drakeposting.name: Drake Posting
drakeposting.meaning: Shows preference by rejecting one thing and approving another
drakeposting.usage: Top panel shows Drake disapproving, bottom shows him approving
drakeposting.example: ❌ Studying for finals | ✅ Binge-watching Netflix at 3am

woman_yelling_at_cat.name: Woman Yelling at Cat
woman_yelling_at_cat.origin: Combines a 2018 Real Housewives scene with a confused cat photo
woman_yelling_at_cat.meaning: Shows two opposing reactions or misunderstandings in a situation
woman_yelling_at_cat.usage: Left side: angry/explaining, Right side: confused/unbothered
woman_yelling_at_cat.example: Parents explaining why I need to study vs Me not caring about their lecture

this_is_fine.name: This Is Fine
this_is_fine.origin: From webcomic artist KC Green in 2013
this_is_fine.meaning: Accepting a disastrous situation while pretending everything is okay
this_is_fine.usage: Shows someone staying calm during chaos or denial of problems
this_is_fine.example: Me sitting in my room saying 'this is fine' while my life falls apart

galaxy_brain.name: Galaxy Brain / Expanding Brain
galaxy_brain.origin: Started around 2017, shows increasingly glowing brain images
galaxy_brain.meaning: Ironically shows 'ascending' levels of intelligence, usually getting dumber
galaxy_brain.usage: Each level shows a 'smarter' but actually worse idea
galaxy_brain.example: Small brain: Study | Big brain: Cram night before | Galaxy brain: Just wing it

spiderman_pointing.name: Spider-Man Pointing at Spider-Man
spiderman_pointing.meaning: When two people/things are exactly the same or accusing each other
spiderman_pointing.usage: Shows similarity, hypocrisy, or mutual accusations
spiderman_pointing.example: Me and my friend both saying we're the responsible one in the friendship

is_this_a_pigeon.name: Is This a Pigeon?
is_this_a_pigeon.origin: From 1990s anime 'The Brave Fighter of Sun Fighbird'
is_this_a_pigeon.meaning: Misidentifying something obvious or being completely wrong
is_this_a_pigeon.usage: Shows someone confidently being incorrect about something
is_this_a_pigeon.example: Me looking at any bird: 'Is this a pigeon?'

two_buttons.name: Two Buttons
two_buttons.origin: From comic artist Jake Clark in 2015
two_buttons.meaning: Being unable to choose between two conflicting options
two_buttons.usage: Shows difficult decisions or internal conflicts
two_buttons.example: Button 1: Sleep early | Button 2: Watch one more episode | Me: *sweating*

surprised_pikachu.name: Surprised Pikachu
surprised_pikachu.origin: From Pokémon anime (1997), became meme in 2018
surprised_pikachu.meaning: Mock surprise at predictable or obvious outcomes
surprised_pikachu.usage: Shows ironic shock when something expected happens
surprised_pikachu.example: Me shocked my pizza rolls are hot after microwaving them for 3 minutes

hide_the_pain_harold.name: Hide the Pain Harold
hide_the_pain_harold.origin: Stock photos of Hungarian model András Arató
hide_the_pain_harold.meaning: Forced smile hiding internal pain or discomfort
hide_the_pain_harold.usage: Represents trying to stay positive during difficult situations
hide_the_pain_harold.example: Me smiling at my relatives asking about my grades while dying inside
